website_summaries.verdict: This secure mount keeps your phone stable enough to read while you're on the move.
pros: Fits smartphones measuring up to 3.7-inch width
Fits handlebars measuring between 0.9 and 1.3 inches in diameter
Strong adjustable clamp and silicone bands work together to grip phone securely
Ball and socket rotation gives full screen access
Keeps phone stable enough to read
cons: Can slip down handlebars if you encounter too much vibration

customer_reviews.title: Rock Solid
customer_reviews.text: I have a big, and expensive, Note 4. I wanted to use it on my ride but I'm scared to death of it failing off.The fact product has the mount and the rubber securing it made me take a chance on it. I love it! The phone doesn't move at all. I'm a happy camper now as I can play my music through my bluetooth headphones and I don't lose the connection. Update (9/5/16): I've now bought a second one for my Elliptigo Bike. That bike is a firm ride and if you've ever been on San Diego streets you know how horrible they are. Again, Rock Solid. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Insane Diego

customer_reviews.title: This is definitely an excellent product for someone who is looking for an affordable ...
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely an excellent product for someone who is looking for an affordable way to mount their phone to their motorcycle handle bars. I have bought two because even after wrecking my motorcycle the phone was still in the holder and still firmly attached to my bars. The only reason I do not have the original is because i failed to remove it from my bike before the wrecker took my bike. I bought another one for my new motorcycle. Install is quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 5min
customer_reviews.text: The clamp broke within 5 minutes sue to vibration from bike and road. Luckily I was headed to the gas station and not straight onto the highway or my phone would have been a goner. Don't waste your money like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S.

customer_reviews.title: Great motorcycle phone mount!
customer_reviews.text: Mounted quickly, and feels sturdy. I have only been on 1 ride so far (60 miles round trip), but my phone was secure the whole time. *update* 01NOV Been out 14 times since installing, mount is still great. Feels solid on the motorcycle and my phone (Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge +) feels solid in the mount. I would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart..
customer_reviews.text: Cheap.. literally fell apart the first time I used it. The clamp portion separated from the part attached to the bike. If I hadn't been using the rubber retainers, it would have been a very expensive error in judgement with my phone flying off somewhere. Unfortunately since it was bought a month ago, I'm totally screwed. No worries, will never buy from the manufacturer and vendor again.
customer_reviews.author: manVaCamp2000

customer_reviews.title: Works so good!
customer_reviews.text: This bike mount works so good. I've had many different bicycle cell phone holders only to find my phone getting loose or eventually falling out. The vibrelli mount easily holds my phone and doesn't damage my phone in any way with tight clamps. I ride mountain bikes agessively, jumps etc, and my phone stays securely in place. Regardless what kind of cell phone case you use, it will work. It should fit for 90% of phones, unless you have a "+" plus size phone. Apple or Android plus size phones are probably to big to fit inside the spring loaded clamp. For everyone else, I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Falcon408

customer_reviews.title: Works great!  Not so good
customer_reviews.text: Used it on my hardtail and full suspension mountain bike riding down choppy rocks, and it holds it in place. I have a Pixel 2, and the mount pushes the volume buttons. I slide it up, but it will creep back down. I use volume lock on my phone once it is in place so the buttons don't turn down the volume. _ 1 star on versatility for this. Updated: Snapped at swivel that holds the phone. Lost my phone, but some one returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Griff

customer_reviews.title: Holds my iPhone 11 in a waterproof case securely.
customer_reviews.text: Just did a 4 day bikepacking trip and used this mounted to my bike stem for navigating & communicating. It held my phone securely over bumpy roads and gravel trails. Pros: Easy to install. Holds phone very well where I can see it. Cons: No way to quickly release phone to say, snap a picture. Depending on your phone, rubber mesh can cover (or even push) some side buttons as well as cover the corner of the screen. I had problems with my phone being switched to silent mode by the rubber bands as well as covering my battery level in the upper corner. Not a big deal, I just had to be careful where I placed the rubber.
customer_reviews.author: Skipjack2001

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation and easy phone attachment!
customer_reviews.text: Everything is included in the box to install the holder. Very quic and easy installation. The bolt is metal along with matching metal nut. Had a different version from another company and all of the connecting pieces were CHEAP plastic! This one is much more secure. The mechanism to open the phone holder is simple and gets tight as needed on the phone. They give you THREE of the rubber style holders that hold in the four corners of the phone. You can use one at a time or attach all three. In my case one of them works just fine. Highly recommend this phone holder for your bicycle.
customer_reviews.author: Bill A.

customer_reviews.title: Beware the elastics - it could cost you a cell phone
customer_reviews.text: The cellp[hone is allegedly secured by compression arms on the sides and an elastic web-like contraption that is designed to secure the four corners of the phone. It uses elastics in an effort to be all things to all phones, whether they have a four of six inch screen. Not good. The last ride I completed left two of the corners unsecured ( I have an Iphone 8 - it might hold a larger phone more securely. I was fortunate the at the two unsecured corners were diametrically opposed, otherwise the phone may have squirted out of the holder. Probably works better with the larger phones.
customer_reviews.author: douglas webb

customer_reviews.title: Hunk 'o junk
customer_reviews.text: Add this product to the list of products that somehow have a high rating on amazon. This thing is garbage. I read about its versatility and its durability – its neither. It wasn't able to fit on my roadbike's handbars with any of the supplied hardware and when I tried to take it off to try using parts from a previous mount to make the fit tighter the plastic stripped. This was a one-time adjustment. It's not like I had it for weeks or months. A single use and this thing broke so bad I had to use vice grips to tear it off. Total piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Howe

customer_reviews.title: Cheap parts
customer_reviews.text: Just ordered my 2nd one of these. First lasted for a couple of years then broke on one side. I took it apart. There is a strong metal spring on each side. But the weakness or flaw is that the springs are just attached to a little plastic knob that will break or deform over time. C'mon man. You otherwise have a good product and design but the whole set up is predicated on a cheap plastic part.
customer_reviews.author: srm

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: Will not at all work for any phone with buttons on the side. Buyer beware, returns not allowed.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid, even for mountain biking!
customer_reviews.text: Did my first MTB ride with this mount, roughly 12 miles on rough trails with plenty of jumping and drops. The mount did not move a bit and the phone was 100% solid the entire ride. I used one silicone strap thing and my iPhone XR is in a protective case already. Fits perfectly, worked flawlessly aside from the silicone thing blocking buttons and the clock in the corners of the phone screen. Perfectly acceptable for the price and otherwise outstanding job it did.
customer_reviews.author: ScottyDon't

customer_reviews.title: I'd be lost without this
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these about two years ago, one for each of my bikes. I commute by bike so they get constant use. I have nothing negative to say about them. They were super easy to install despite the handlebars having different diameters. They're extremely sturdy and even with constant use for two years the rubber isn't showing any wear. And that phone isn't going anywhere! I've biked hundreds of miles, hit my fair share of potholes and even crashed a couple of times and the phone stayed put. Oh, and I live in Portland and bike in the rain all the time. That hasn't affected the quality.
customer_reviews.author: codergrl

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Product lasted all of 3 months and then snapped off my bike. Wrote manufacturer to request a replacement but never heard back.
customer_reviews.author: Mingypants

customer_reviews.title: I purchased the Vibrelli mount after an accident I had ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Vibrelli mount after an accident I had. I was mountain biking while playing Pokemon Go! and a wild jigglypuff appeared. As I had never seen one before I was quite startled, so much so that I accidentally hit my left hand brake instead of my right one causing me to flip over my handlebars and at the same time shattering the screen on my brand new phone (as well as a sore back for a week or two). Anyway, while I haven't seen a jigglypuff since that day I have confidence that when I do my phone will be secure in this new mount (and hopefully my back as well).
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Phone stays in place even when you don't
customer_reviews.text: I recently started mountain biking again. For better or worse I have a bunch of friends who are much better riders and in much better condition than I am. On my most recent ride I fell more than I normally do in a month (one clip was too tight and I couldn't always get out of it in time). The mount remained secure and phone in place. It did move a little, but nothing that would result in any damage. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Clark L.

customer_reviews.title: Over a year's worth of use and still holding strong.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this holder to mount to my Victory Hardball Motorcycle and am impressed with the durability of this holder. I spent far less than my fellow riders and it is still holding strong! Was careful during install to make sure things were snug but not over tighten so as to not crack the bracket and I believe that was key to getting a good strong hold on the handlebars of my scoot. UPDATE (5/19): Other than the straps wearing out (which is gonna happen)... mount is still holding strong and the company stands behind their product 100%!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael LeBlanc

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted!!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't use it on every ride but when I do its great! I feel like my phone is secure and it's nice to have handy. The only reason for the 4 star on mounting is because the top strap does hit the volume button at times if not careful.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Decker

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly versatile
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use with an iphone 5s and also used it with a galaxy S9. The silicone holds things in place very well, even the larger S9, but it covers some of the screen and it's impossible to remove the phone without pressing buttons on the screen. The phone angle is adjustable but the range is limited. Overall a reasonable investment, does what it's supposed to do and is weather proof.
customer_reviews.author: Gus Mulder

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy for S8 or S8+
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake in thinking it would work for my S8 & S8+, and while the phones do fit in the mount, its the volume buttons that are not in the right spot for it to be suitable. The rubber strap at the corner presses down on the volume button and doesnt allow your phone to sleep or anything. I gave it 4⭐ cause the mount does work as far as keeping the phone secure, its the rubber corners that may pose a problem for other phones like mines.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Will buy another one for my wife. Nice product.
customer_reviews.text: This holder is quite good. Took an over the bars digger 2nd time out with it and it held phone perfectly...a little dusty now but holds my phone no problem through some pretty rough terrain. I will be buying another one for my wife's road bike, I wanted to test first to make sure it would hold her phone and not be a distraction or safety issue....just be careful not to crank too hard on the lock nut/ring when positioning as I think it could get damaged...so even with modest torquing the holder keeps phone in place and level on bars.
customer_reviews.author: kent

customer_reviews.title: NOT Universal
customer_reviews.text: It is quite a stretch to call it universal. It was a struggle getting it to fit in my iPhone 8 Plus with a life proof case on. The plastic is cheap, and the clamps fit very awkwardly on the phone and did not hold it securely. Wish I could return it, waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I love this on my recumbent bike. This way I have a place to put my phone and use the navigation or music player. Great addition to a bike and cheaper than getting a bike computer
customer_reviews.author: Matt Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, easy to install, my phone is quite large and it fits just fine, but easily scalable to fit smaller phones/devices as well. I like the multiple elastic holders in the different colors, makes it look great as well as highly functional, and combining them for added stability looks awesome! The materials seem to be of very good quality. Did not strike me as cheaply made, if anything changed in this regard I will of course leave an update on this review. I would recommend this to anyone shopping for a similar holder!
customer_reviews.author: DragonMaster

customer_reviews.title: Motorcycle use
customer_reviews.text: This is great! And not just great for the price. It is just that good. It clamps the phone very tightly. I have a Harley Davidson Strwet Bob and at idle and low speeds the bars shake ALOT! This holds the phone very firmly, I even find myself checking it often and it is still firmly in place. Even hit a large pot hole and it stayed in place.The only reason I didn't give it a five is the band's are a little thin and weak, bUT you do get 3 and you can double up if you want. I still "dummy cord" my phone but that is only because I don't want to take any chances.
customer_reviews.author: SFC

customer_reviews.title: Nice clamp for my motorcycle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my iPhone 7 to mount it on my motorcycle handlebars. I have a Kawasaki with 7/8” diameter handlebars.At first I didn’t think it would work out but I used all 3 rubber shims and when I tightened the screw it clamped to the bar very nicely. I ended up replacing the screw with a shorter one. The phone is held tight and secure. I haven’t ridden the motorcycle yet but I think this mount will do nicely. If it does I will redo this review with 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: TomL

customer_reviews.title: Great for an indoor trainer, not designed to absorb vibration
customer_reviews.text: The usefulness of this phone mount depends on how you use it. If you're using it on a stationary trainer in your home, it's a good product. If you need a phone mount you can use when riding outdoors, the plastic is rigid and will therefore will be prone to break due to vibration . I used this mount many times on my indoor trainer and was pleased. I used it on two bike rides, 42 miles, before it broke during a ride/race where I needed navigation. Fortunately my phone survived.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Rock-Solid Grip
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this. Grips my Nexus 6p very well, and it's a pretty big phone, and the volume/power buttons on the side mean I have to position it slightly higher. I did at one point forget to use the silicon bands and on a particularly nasty bump my phone fell out, so don't forget to use them! Used properly (ahem!) this holder instills confidence and I no longer even think of my phone falling when I go for vigorous rides. It's great.
customer_reviews.author: omuomu

customer_reviews.title: Good phone holder
customer_reviews.text: This bike mount is very sturdy and works well, after I adjusted the tension nut that keeps it from swiveling. I had to use all three spacers on my handlebars, and it made the bolt eyelets bend funny before I put the bolt/nut on. I was a little worried they might break. I just tightened it slowly and did not overdo it, and it works great. When the phone is strapped in properly, the band covers my silence button on the iPhone 6s but it is very easy to push aside to mute the phone if I want. I have no real issues with it and am really enjoying having my phone so accessible for GPS and other apps.
customer_reviews.author: Porkins

customer_reviews.title: Works Great with iPhone 6  and Otterbox Defender case mounted on a Road Bike!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using it for a few months on my road bike and definitely recommend it to anyone that commutes or needs to use the GPS while riding their bike. Regardless of the terrain I’ve been riding on, the phone mount which is reinforced with the silicone rubber grip is able to securely hold my phone on my bike. Haven’t had any issues yet; nothing broken, no phone drops, no cracks on the device. But even if my phone were to drop (currently using an iPhone 6), I made sure to get an Otterbox Defender case for maximum protection. Definitely recommend this case to anyone using a smartphone for GPS while bike riding! It's an awesome investment.
customer_reviews.author: Miraflor

customer_reviews.title: Does its job well!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter with an eye towards checking it out and getting another if it works well. Installed it for a test run and had no issues getting it on. Put the phone in and rode the neighborhood with my wife. Stayed in place, phone stayed on and it didn't vibrate at neighborhood speeds. I am going to buy two more for myself and my other kid. Nice product!
customer_reviews.author: Dee Dee Brenneman

customer_reviews.title: From someone unsure and skeptical about the purchase
customer_reviews.text: This product only lost one star because it didn’t come with directions. This material also doesn’t seem super sturdy. However, it’s not a super cheap product either and it gets the job done, so don’t hesitate to buy this product. I found it the most useful in the middle of my bike. I do feel like my IPhone 8 is being squeezed too much if I use two bands but I don’t go on rocky roads. I only go on a bike path up and down slow inclines on the pacific electric trail. Somebody doing rocky roads probably should use two.
customer_reviews.author: shyeilrz

customer_reviews.title: Good grasp and steady hold.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty well made! It holds my phone steady in place even with road bumps and engine vibration. It was easy to install and seems capable of fitting just about any size handlebar. Your phone won't be falling out of this thing. the clamp alone holds it very snug but the added webbing means the only thing that can forced your phone out of it would be an accident but we're not having anything like that anyway.
customer_reviews.author: A Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm, 3 years later
customer_reviews.text: I tried a couple of mounts looking for the best one, and once I installed and started using Vibrelli's I stopped looking. It holds the phone in a solid grip using the stretch band (I'm using one of them), and is solidly mounted to the bike bar in easy reach. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Solid mount for my mountain bike
customer_reviews.text: This works well with my mountain bike. It comes with pieces of rubber to fill in the void when mounting to various size tubes on your bike. It's easy to set up and use. It came with three different color webs to hold the four corners of the phone to the mount. The side clips hold the phone well but it's best to use the web when riding. It has the same feel as a car mount for your phone the back can be pivoted. For anyone wanting a mount for the phone this one would be the one to start with. Ride safe and only look at the phone when you absolutely have to.
customer_reviews.author: AAC9598

customer_reviews.title: iPhone 6S+ mount
customer_reviews.text: Product appears to be as stated and works well. I like the fact that it has extra silicone bands that hold your phone in addition to the spring-loaded holder. I mounted it to my diamondback mountain bike handlebars and it seems to hold my large iPhone 6 Plus without any problem at all. I have an OtterBox commuter case on it as well and it still fits. This product has exceeded my expectations as it holds the phone pretty tight and it is easily accessible.
customer_reviews.author: J. Feldman

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely buy this bike phone holder again.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great phone mount holder for your bike. I have used it almost daily since I have purchased it and it does a really good job of securing your phone while you are riding. I have even tested it on a rough trail where it was violently shaking and it still held my phone with no problem! It feels well built and I like the 3 different colors of silicone it comes with.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Love this phone holder - use it almost every time I go out on my mobility scooter
customer_reviews.text: Being handicapped makes it difficult to access your smart phone when you are out - this allows me to have it accessible while shopping... installed it on my Drive mobility scooter handlebar and it is perfect. My only concern is how long the rubber band style corner holders will last but they include 3 so I suspect I may get several years of use before I need to replace it. Very pleased with this item.
customer_reviews.author: Tarheelinva

customer_reviews.title: mount snapped failure of plastic
customer_reviews.text: was riding on a flat surface when the mount with phone attached snapped off--the attached pictures show plastic fatigue I am hoping the manufacturer seller does the right thing and replaces at no charge ---I was lucky as phone hit my foot before falling to the ground saving my phone screen from shattering
customer_reviews.author: ellie brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great value and great holder when mounted properly.
customer_reviews.text: I only have 2 rides with this phone holder totaling over 100 miles. The first ride was not good as I did not righted the base around my handlebars enough. The base is too small for 2 rubber inserts so I could only use one. I ended putting a few wraps of tape on the handlebars and then 1 insert was plenty tight enough. The holder was perfect on my second ride. The phone did not move at all and I was able to see maps, texts, etc on the phone. I had a life proof case and life proof bike mount and they only lasted one biking season. Those totaled about $75, this case was $20! Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A. Malucci

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for the wrong item...
customer_reviews.text: Well, I decided to try something new and ordered this phone mount. I'm sure the product is much better than I'm eating it, however I received a completely different item, and it wasn't even complete. I was sent an "air vent car mount" instead of this phone mount, so I'm sorry that I can't accurately assess the value of this item. Maybe try sending the right product...
customer_reviews.author: TXvet89

customer_reviews.title: Great help to have!
customer_reviews.text: After constantly having to stop and have to get phone out of pocket to see map, purchased this product based on great reviews. It works wonderfully. Have to say I haven't used for very long, so may have more feedback after more bike trips. Phone fits very secure. I have S6 Active so rain no concern, that's only consideration if your phone isn't waterproof. I'm glad not to have additional housing since I feel I can see the screen much better this way and quickly remove phone if needed. I always take phone with me when I step away from bike and it's easy to remove and reattach.
customer_reviews.author: GrantsPassOR

customer_reviews.title: Fits phones a tad over 3.5in
customer_reviews.text: I've mostly go some concerns about false advertisement. I would have given it 4 stars if not for the page about this product lying. This holder fits a maximum of a 3.5in wide phone and that's assuming you want to force it in. It barely fits my Galaxy S5 and the silicon bands have to be very stretched to get around the corners. The product does feel pretty solid and secure it is just more snug than I would like and they lied about the phone size. Note the picture says 4.5in, the page says 3.7in, in reality it's a little over 3.5in
customer_reviews.author: Derrick

customer_reviews.title: Solid Mount, Very Securely Holds Your Device
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered a third device for my daughters bike. This is a very good phone mount that will hold virtually any phone. (I assume some of the largest might not work). Phone is very secure in the device and it is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: The whole thing does seem pretty stable, although I have not had a chance ...
customer_reviews.text: It securely holds my iPhone 6s Plus which already sits in an Apple silicone case. The mount is very secure on the bike, but the components are made of plastic. On my mountain bike, the tube connecting the handlebars to the frame was too thick, so I have it attached to the handlebars instead. The whole thing does seem pretty stable, although I have not had a chance to take my mountain bike off road yet. So far so good, I do wish the component parts like the ball and tightening nut and such were made of aluminum. If that were the case, this thing would probably last a lifetime or more.
customer_reviews.author: huktunfonikz

customer_reviews.title: Vibrelli phone bike mount
customer_reviews.text: This bike mount exceeded my expectations. It's unobtrusive, takes little space on the handlebar, and looks good on the bike. My main concern was how it would handle the road which in my case, includes frequent rough patches of pavement and off road. It did really well; the unit is sturdy and steady and keeps a confident grip on the valuable iPhone 6S. Also, it pivots easily from vertical to horizontal view with one quick manual adjustment, which I found useful for gps. Couldn't be happier as it heightens my daily bike escapades...
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S

customer_reviews.title: Broke After Just Over a Year of Road Bike Use.
customer_reviews.text: The neck underneath the round head that swivels inside the nut broke after just over a year of road bike use. THEY DID REFUND MY MONEY THOUGH! Plus the bracket is WAY TOO BIG for 25.4 mm handlebars. I had to use THREE spacers to mount it.
customer_reviews.author: Red1rider

customer_reviews.title: Works fine.
customer_reviews.text: I have an IPhone 8 with an Otter Box case, and mounted it on my bike. Works fine. There are a lot of products to choose from. I have no complaints for this one
customer_reviews.author: Gary O.

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Secure Mount for Your Phone
customer_reviews.text: Holds your phone it’s positon securely. Accidentally left my phone on my bike after I had placed it on my rack and twenty minures latter, after driving on the interstate, my phone was still there! Eliminates the need to buy a separate speed and cadence meter, just pair your phone with your sensors.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin F.

customer_reviews.title: Broke extremely easily
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for less than 2 months to hold my phone in place for less than 10 rides. Once, while I was on a ride with the phone strapped in and hit a patch of rocky road, the shakiness was enough to snap the holder. This breaking fell *right outside* of my return window. I can't help but think that maybe it's designed this way so that you can't return it. I'd really like for the seller to refund or replace this order.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Practical phone mount
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to carry my phone in while I’m riding my bike and this is perfect. I mounted it right on the front of the handlebars. I do not talk while riding but it’s handy to have in case of a problem you may have. It’s perfect
customer_reviews.author: Linda Wise

customer_reviews.title: Will hold a phone in a wallet case.
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my motorcycle & it fit great. My phone is in a wallet case & was concerned it would not fit, so put two of the rubber grippers on it. The phone case is thick, so it's a very tight fit, but looks like it will hold. Due to all of the rain we are having, I haven't had a chance to ride & see how well it holds up, but think it will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Good solid bike mount for iPhone 6
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this bike mount after seeing it on a friend's bike. It holds my iPhone very securely and makes it easy to use. I like that you can swivel the mount in any direction. I feel my phone is completely safe in this mount. I did have to use both small rubber fillers to mount it on my bike. It is very solidly on my handlebars. I had purchased another bike mount but it was not moveable and had a huge strap that went across the phone rendering it unreadable.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon L. Bradt

customer_reviews.title: Good product but flawed design for iPhone 6plus
customer_reviews.text: I bought it few months ago. The concept is great and light. Hold my iphone 6plus on a smooth ride. The big issue is tthe top straps can make ur phone "mute" either by volume buttons or due to mute button moving up as the strap lays on top of it- It can get "turned off" since the volumes and power buttons are on the side, on a slightly bumpy ride. Vibrelli was better off creating a hook like the side hooks for the top so that problem does not happen. I am still using it but might return the item if the problem persists.
customer_reviews.author: Cyclistan

customer_reviews.title: This phone mount is terrific. It is great to be able to see ...
customer_reviews.text: This phone mount is terrific. It is great to be able to see my GPS if I need to. My phone is one of the biggest models but it fits pretty well and I've never had a problem. Very secure. The only issue is that if your power and volume rocker buttons are near the middle of your phone you will not be able to center it in the holder but this has not cause problems for me. I position the grips underneath the buttons and even though it looks like it would be insecure it isn't.
customer_reviews.author: Olive

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not durable
customer_reviews.text: Product broke twice, different parts of it too. Durability seems to be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Justin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but larger phones may need two rubber grips
customer_reviews.text: This has kept my phone nice and secure while biking. I will say though if you have a larger phone it is a really tight fit using a single rubber grip holder. The grip holders are designed so that when you place the grip onto the holder one end is longer than the other. So what I ended up doing is mounting two rubber grips onto the holder instead of one, secured it, then used the longer ends of the two grips to hold my larger phone. This method has worked out perfectly for me and my phone is very secure.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. No issue with phone fit (Pixel 2). Stays put. I was cognizant of the other reviews with respect to breaking; therefore, was careful not to over tighten. Been using for a month and has worked, so far, as promised. I'll revise review of any issue arises.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad Steven Paz

customer_reviews.title: Everything I had hoped for
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my bike for indoor cardio. The swiveling mount makes it easy to watch streaming media while exercising on your phone or using it as music/navigation device. Mounting was simple with a single hex screw. Includes multiple strips of foam tape to ensure a solid mount to your bars or gooseneck. The Silicone bands provide a secure hold while allowing access to the basic buttons of the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: It comes with different size rubber gaskets to fit different diameter handlebars, but the default one fits mine perfectly. It holds the phone (Samsung S8) snug on trails with no movement yet full access to the controls.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Didn't move when you hit a bump
customer_reviews.text: It was fairly easy to install, but the best thing is that when riding it did not slip on the handle bars when you hit a bump. The rubber strips they provide that you insert between the handle bars and the mount hold it in place. Another brand I bought just had the plastic against the metal handle bars and it would slip a bit if I hit a bump. This one doesn't do that.
customer_reviews.author: David R Bulanda

customer_reviews.title: not sure about this
customer_reviews.text: these never work for me, I put these on my bike and they seem so always get lose and I have to keep moving it to make sure it does not fall off, after a couple of times on my cycling rides I just stopped using it. don't trust my phone on them.
customer_reviews.author: Tammie Soto

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a good product
customer_reviews.text: We bought three different bike mounts to compare. None were what I would call the 'perfect' mount (I would love to combine features of several), but all three work well. The Vibrelli is solidly built, and I am pleased with it, though I have concerns about how well the socket will hold up - only time will tell. Based on what we have tried so far, and with the caveat mentioned, I would have no problem recommending this product.
customer_reviews.author: Rienk Ayers

customer_reviews.title: Great phone holder!
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my Honda Rebel CMX250C. On the road half a day. Lots of bumps, wind, highway and local speed limits. This didn't budge. I was worried at first that my phone would be too big (Samsung Galaxy S9+) but it held perfectly! Came with 2 different color holders, too! Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Pfeifer

customer_reviews.title: So far I love having this mount
customer_reviews.text: Update: 1 1/2 months later only a handful of times used the mount snapped clean off. Almost looks like a weak point in the plastic mold. Previous post: So far I love having this mount. My Samsung S8 Plus is 100% accessible when I am on my bicycle. I plan on buying one for my motorcycle as well. I also like that the buttons on my phone do not get pressed when the phone is on the mount with the rubber corners on. Unless the mount were to break the phone is not going to go anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: BKrause

customer_reviews.title: Hot Garbage, buy a RAM mount.
customer_reviews.text: The bar clamp broke the first time I installed it. Purchased a RAM mount and have zero complaints. Plus RAM is made in the USA. Don't waste yourbtime with this cheap one.
customer_reviews.author: WSulla

customer_reviews.title: Great design and secure hold but cheap, ill-fitting hardware makes mounting difficult.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great design, it holds the phone well and can be adjusted to the right angle for use. Unfortunately it is marred by cheap hardware that makes it difficult to mount. The bolt and nut don't fit well and the bolt doesn't slide easily into the mount. After way more struggle than should be required I have it tight and I believe it will stay. it would be great if they designed the mounting to be quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: bmathews

customer_reviews.title: Great holding power.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son to use on his BMX bike. The item seems well made and does hold the phone very well. My only issue is that the mount is made for a large diameter handlebar tube. The mount is 1 7/16" and with one shim it's reduced to 1 1/4". Most handlebars are 7/8". He wants a mountain bike for Christmas so I guess we'll wait and mount it on that.
customer_reviews.author: Paul A.

customer_reviews.title: Very good product!
customer_reviews.text: Have owned this a year now. Had a major crash and broke 4 ribs but the iPhone stayed on the bars, exactly where it was supposed to be! Does exactly what it is supposed to do. Installs easily. Rubber spacers are included for various size handlebars. Ball-joint lock ring, once set, doesn't move on my road bike. My iPhone 5s is easy on and easy off. Now if I could just find and easy to use, easy to read Map, Heart Rate App....... P.S. I usually look at the low ratings before purchase but am discovering that some people would have issues unwrapping a stick of gum.
customer_reviews.author: SMarkway

customer_reviews.title: Great phone holder!
customer_reviews.text: Love this extra safe phone holder which turns in every direction and tilts. It's very securely attached and I can answer the phone, make calls, track my ride, etc which biking! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Eloise Halpern

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great universal bike mount! It was very easy to install and it holds my iPhone 8 Plus in its case. The only down side is that I have to remove my pop socket in order for it to fit properly. I can live with this because I love my phone more than my pop socket.
customer_reviews.author: Lovestoshop

customer_reviews.title: This phone mount holds my i phone 6+ just barely ...
customer_reviews.text: This phone mount holds my i phone 6+ just barely! The rubber straps on the corners hold very well. Only problem I had was the center cross bar between my handlebars was only 1/2" and that is where I wanted to mount this phone mount. I had to use all 3 provided pieces of rubber together to get it to mount tightly.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: I must say this item was a great surprise. There were so many options and I ...
customer_reviews.text: I must say this item was a great surprise. There were so many options and I just stumbled on this one. I was so lucky. This mount was well thought out by the designer. It works absolutely perfect! I put it on a Harley with ape hangers so it has a ton of vibration, it NEVER moved at 70 mph. It allowed me to Bluetooth to bike radio. Great product, good follow-up by seller. Choose this one!!
customer_reviews.author: a reader

customer_reviews.title: Easy solution to mounting phone on bike.
customer_reviews.text: Very reasonable and easy way to secure phone to bike. Had it for several months and really don’t know how long it will last but at that price I’d be glad to replace it next year.
customer_reviews.author: travel lover

customer_reviews.title: Motorcycle phone holder
customer_reviews.text: Five stars for now. I have it mounted on a Harley with straight bars. I only rode about 40 miles but it seems to work good. You need to make sure that you position the bands away from the phone buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff F.

customer_reviews.title: it's very secure and mounts to the bike easily.
customer_reviews.text: While it didn't fit my iphone it did fit my husband's. If I take mine out of the case it will fit (iphone 7s). My husband, he has a different case. He uses it a lot as we bike the rails to trails. There has been no issues with the phone coming loose, it's very secure and mounts to the bike easily.
customer_reviews.author: SVT2059

customer_reviews.title: This works perfectly on motorcycles.
customer_reviews.text: Right on! This works great on my H-D Fat Boy. I was apprehensive at first (looked and was cheap -- cost wise), but it works great; steady and hasn't come loose at all. This is a great product and works as advertised. This ended up being a worry-free purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A. C. Lunn

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Great product!!! Needed a stable mount for my iPhone 6S for a century ride. The Vibrelli mount held up better than expected! Minimal road vibration and inspired confidence over the bumpiest of roads. Came with 3 silicone grips for the phone and 3 silicone band grips for the clamp. Easy to install! All buttons accessible on device! Secure!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Pokemon Go and Wizards Unite
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for us to play Pokemon Go and Wizards Unite while walking with the stroller. It was such a great purchase, I wish we had bought it sooner. It’d be good for a stroller for anyone with a smart phone. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: MayTheSchwartzBeWithYou

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Sturdy. I completed a century with it and my phone stayed very secure on the mounting system. I like it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Gracie

customer_reviews.title: Great cell phone holder for biking
customer_reviews.text: Only used it once so far, but going downhill and then over railroad tracks at about 25 mph this thing held my iphone 6 nice and tight. It's nice to have it right in front so I can listen to music while riding easily, and also see if the texts I am receiving are important enough to pull over for or not. Was a little difficult to install as the bar I wanted it on was a little too thick, but I was able to cut the gasket in half and then finally get the bolt to catch. Would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Buyer "Zac"

customer_reviews.title: Using it on Pixel XL, Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, enough spacers included for almost any handlebar diameter, and functions GREAT. Best arrangement I've seen yet. I'm using it for a Pixel XL, and when the holding bands are in place, I have to put my finger under the bands in the back to unlock the phone, but it is not difficult, just a bit more effort than a front fingerprint unlock. For my wife's iPhone 7, this is not at all an issue, as the unlock is on the front.
customer_reviews.author: Walter V Finn

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent phone mount. I ride my bike almost daily and my phone has never budged once even on bumpy roads.
customer_reviews.author: AMENAWON

customer_reviews.title: Shaken, rattled and rolled but stayed put
customer_reviews.text: Installed the holder in minutes before taking it for a ride. Along streets, on dirt and gravel up a hill and my iPhone 6s Plus did not move at all. Coming down the hill hitting a rock and being thrown off the bike taking a tumble (no, didn't get hurt, landed on grass), the bike crashing alongside me I was worried about my phone. IT DIDN'T MOVE FROM THE HOLDER. I must say I used 2 of the silicone straps but the holder worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R

customer_reviews.title: Great for Active Boys on Bikes
customer_reviews.text: It securely fits to any bike and keeps their phones from dropping out of pockets or out of their hands as they ride. Great for GPS directions to follow while riding.
customer_reviews.author: Scristi

customer_reviews.title: So Far......So Good
customer_reviews.text: Got it mounted with a bit of effort. Had to layer some heavy duty tape between the mounting bracket and the handlebar. Two of the supplied inserts left the phone/mount too loose to hold firmly in place. With three the screw wouldn't attach. I'm hoping the elastic web holders don't give up and break. I'm mounting an iPhone 8+ in a Otter Box Defender. Fits just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Works really well for an iPhone 6 in an Otterbox Symmetry case
customer_reviews.text: This phone mount works really well for an iPhone 6 in an Otterbox Symmetry case. It holds it snugly, and I don't worry about losing it while riding. Installation was easy, and getting the phone in and out of the mount is pretty straightforward and not bothersome.
customer_reviews.author: S. Jentsch

customer_reviews.title: The value is outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing! The value of this mount is just incredible. The sturdiness of the product is not something you'd expect of a $100.00 product, but this thing 1/5 of that price and delivers everything you would expect and more at that price. It will literally fit any phone you might get, save for possibly "fablets" which are more like a tablet than a phone. I would absolutely recommend this product if this is the issue you're trying to find a solution for.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Smith

customer_reviews.title: This worked out great. Super strong bands
customer_reviews.text: I have a Harley-Davidson Breakout, I needed something to hold my phone when riding so I could see my GPS or listen to music and be able to see it at all times. My concern was I have no wind shield. This worked out great. Super strong bands, comes with 3,only need one.
customer_reviews.author: CGO5989

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike Phone Mount!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, light, easy to attach and use. Holds phone securely with a single strap but two would be good just to be safe on bumpy roads or trails. I also like how it swivels. Nice to finally have my phone visible while I ride, especially when on city streets and I need the directions!
customer_reviews.author: Kbezfmly

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Just about the only mount I've found that fits the 6S Plus encased in an Otterbox Defender. The fiit is tight and virtually at its tolerance limit, but fit it does. My only concern at this point is the longevity of the bands used to fully secure the phone in the mount. Only time and usage will tell.
customer_reviews.author: lonestarmike

customer_reviews.title: Great phone holder for a bike.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for holding my phone while bike riding. Easy to set up and the phone feel secure. Have used it for a few months now with no issues. Even bought another for my fiancé’s bike. Easy set up too.
customer_reviews.author: Yearlynine

customer_reviews.title: Bike Phone Mount that you can rely on
customer_reviews.text: The Vibrelli bike phone mount works great. I use it for my iPhone 6. It was easy to install on my bike and takes only seconds to insert and secure the phone. Removing the phone is also quick and easy. I have ridden over some very rough roads, including cobblestones, and the phone remains securely in the mount. I was nervous about using it at first but now that I've put it through a lot of bumps, shakes and bone-jarring vibrations I have no worries. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Larry W.

customer_reviews.title: Ideal For Motorcycles.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a handlebar mount for my Moto G cell that would fit the large bar on my Kawasaki Versys 1000. This is seriously big enough to fit any motorcycle bar. I used two of the rubber shims to mount it securely. It holds my phone very securely, although, in my case, it's protected behind a short windscreen. Make sure you use the enclosed nut to screw the bolt into. It looks as if there is a nut already embedded in the plastic, but you need the nut to really hold it securely.
customer_reviews.author: George Leroy Tirebiter

customer_reviews.title: Trustworthy mount.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little apprehensive about strapping my phone to my handle bars, but this phone mount assuaged those fears. If you are worried (like I was) about your phone falling out, you can use two of the silicon straps to hold onto your phone. Installs fairly easily, with a little bolt and rubber lining in the arm/clasp to reduce the chance of it moving. The ball hinge is easy to adjust and locks in place well. Great for general biking as well as pokemon egg hatching.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: great phone mount for my bike
customer_reviews.text: Install very easy. Secured to handlebars with one allen screw--wrench provided. Holds phone in place securely with two methods. Great product at nice price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McD

customer_reviews.title: Great for my iPhone
customer_reviews.text: Fits my iPhone 5s very well. The silicon holder is resilient and the package comes with 3 total. My only issue with this mount has been the rubber strips that come with for adapting to handlebar size. I can fit two strips on and have a little wiggle with the phone mounted. Three strips (the total included) is too large for my bike. All things considered, the mount is secure and adjustable to my cycling posture. The mount has held on through off road and on road cycling. I am confident in the security this provides my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Arielle

customer_reviews.title: Good Product.  Flexible across multiple smartphones.
customer_reviews.text: I initially was going to purchase a Lifeproof bike mount for my iPhone 6 until I read the ratings on Amazon. Continued my search until I found the Vibrelli mount. I've now used the Vibrelli mount on several rides and it has performed perfectly. Holds the iPhone securely in place, no wobble. Was very easy to install using the adapters to fit my handlebar. I can't speak to durability of the rubber straps as it is too new but they same sturdy and made with good quality elastic. The mount comes with 2 spare straps.
customer_reviews.author: Christian
